H0.text: Fossil fuels are formed in shallow areas over short periods of time.

H1.text: Fossil fuels are formed from the remains of organisms.

H2.text: Fossil fuels are formed in underground reservoirs that are relatively cool.

H3.text: Fossil fuels are formed by high winds and temperatures.

A4.text: The origin of fossil fuels is the anaerobic decomposition of buried dead organisms.

A5.text: The conversion from these organic materials to high-carbon fossil fuels is typically the result of a geological process of millions of years.
